content.description:
Pitch 1 (90 feet):  Crux pitch.  Climb up then trend left and later right to a comfortable belay ledge with bolted anchor and chains.  Check out the cool eagle's nest to the right. 

  Pitch 2 (70 feet):  Again climb up then trend left and later right to the bolted anchor and chains.
content.protection: A standard trad rack with pieces up to 2 1/2 inches.  Bring an adequate number of 24" runners.  There are two bolts on the first pitch and belay/rap anchors at the top of each pitch.
content.location: The route follows the central weakness in the cliff.  Rap the route with a single 60m.

content.description: Starting left of X Man at the lowest portion of the wall is Recon, 5.6, 180'. Climb a block leaning against the face 20', continue up and pass a block on the right side, proceed up and slightly right until you reach an upper balcony and a corner, about 130'. Second pitch follows the corner, swallows pro and can be used for a first trad lead.---If you use X Man as a rap route with a single 60 meter rope, recommended, be sure to lay your ropes to the right on the first rappel. As you get further down it's difficult to reach the ledge which seems hidden to the right, partially obscured by a bulge. You could easily not see the bolts and rap off your rope.
content.location: Starts left of X Man at the lowest portion of the wall

content.description: Start by climbing an obvious 70' continuous layback covered in green lichen to a ramp. Climb the ramp to a cave, exit the cave via either of two cracks to the top.You can also reach the cave by climbing the wide chimney and passing the chock stone at the top.--- If you use X Man as a rap route with a single 60 meter rope, recommended, be sure to lay your ropes to the right on the first rappel. As you get further down it's difficult to reach the ledge which seems hidden to the right, partially obscured by a bulge. You could easily not see the bolts and rap off your rope.
content.location: Located to the right of X Man

content.description: This is the large crag, about 160 feet high, roughly three quarters of a mile south of Luna Park on the east side of the road.
